meanings.definition: A large tub or vat used for washing or brewing.
meanings.sent1: The farmer filled the kieve with water to wash the vegetables.
meanings.sent2: The brewery used a kieve to brew their special beer.
meanings.sent3: The kieve was so big, it could fit a whole person inside for a bath!
meanings.sent4: The kieve stood in the corner like a giant bowl waiting to be filled.
meanings.sent5: The kieve gleamed in the sunlight, inviting everyone to come and see.

meanings.definition: To wash or brew in a kieve.
meanings.sent1: She decided to kieve the clothes by hand instead of using the washing machine.
meanings.sent2: The chef kieved the ingredients together to create a delicious soup.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally kieved the clothes with hot water, turning everything pink!
meanings.sent4: The sound of the water kieving in the tub was soothing after a long day.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the herbs kieving in the pot filled the kitchen with a delightful scent.
